articles.title: Functions Held Abroad on Occasion of Day of Sun
Korean People's Efforts for National Reunification Supported
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire in Nepal
articles.content:
Korean People's Efforts for National Reunification Supported 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator (leader) of the National Executive Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico, expressed full support and solidarity for the Workers' Party and people of Korea in their struggle to achieve national reunification when meeting So Jae Myong, DPRK ambassador to Mexico, who paid a courtesy call on him on March 17.
 He said that their struggle to protect the sovereignty of the country and the ideology and social system chosen by them from the U.S. threat of aggression is just and will surely be crowned with victory.    
 He wished the Korean people a brilliant success in their efforts to build a great prosperous powerful socialist nation this year marking the 60th anniversaries of the WPK and the liberation of Korea, under the wise leadership of General Secretary   Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Preparatory Committee of Koreans in Russia Inaugurated
Revolutionary Cause of Korean People Supported in Serbia and Montenegro
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee of Koreans in Russia Inaugurated 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia for commemorating the Day of the Sun was inaugurated on Mar. 16.
 At the inaugural ceremony Chairman of the Association Ju Hui Chol was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and First Vice-Chairperson of the Association Jang Sun Jong its vice-chairperson.    
 The committee decided to organize colorful functions such as a commemoration meeting, a remembrance gathering, a film show, a lecture and a photo and book exhibition and release a special information bulletin.

articles.title: Diplomas of Graduation Posthumously Presented to S. Korean Schoolgirls
Day of Sun to be Commemorated in France
Stop to Anti-North War Exercises Urged
articles.content:
Day of Sun to be Commemorated in France 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun was inaugurated by the France-Korea Friendship Association on March 15.
 At the inaugural ceremony, the delegate president of the association was elected chairman of the preparatory committee and the secretary general of the International Liaison Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea and the secretary general of the association vice-chairmen of the preparatory committee.    
 The preparatory committee fixed a commemoration period ending on April 20 and decided to hold colorful functions such as a meeting and a photo exhibition in the period.

articles.title: Joint Declaration for Peace against War Published
articles.content:
Stop to Anti-North War Exercises Urged 
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council of Youth Organizations on March 19 reportedly issued a statement titled "Stop at once anti-north war exercises harassing the movement for peace against war, and national cooperation."
 The statement said the south Korea-U.S. joint military exercises are a rehashed version of the Team Spirit joint drill targeted against the north, being a large-scale war game intended to deploy U.S. forces in south Korea from overseas bases and ensure rapid field maneuverability "in case of emergency" on the Korean Peninsula.    
  The U.S. should clearly see the desire of all the people and promptly stop the war rehearsals hourly pushing the situation on the peninsula to the brink of war and the government authorities should choose to seek national cooperation, not "south Korea-U.S. alliance" thoroughly saturated with a hostile policy towards the north, urged the statement.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of Reunification Supported
Japan's Claim to Tok Islet Flayed
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of Reunification Supported
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- The Southwest Africa People's Organization and people of Namibia will always render positive support to the Workers'
Party of Korea and the Korean people in their just cause of defending the sovereignty of the country against the interference of outsiders and achieving the peaceful reunification of the country, declared President of SWAPO Sam Nujoma. He received Vice-President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Yang Hyong Sop heading a DPRK delegation on a visit to Namibia, who paid a courtesy call on him on March 22.
 He expressed hearty thanks to leader Kim Jong Il for having sent a high-level delegation to the celebrations of the 15th anniversary of the independence of Namibia and the inaugural ceremony of the new president of Namibia.    
 He said he is thankful for and always remembers the moral and material support rendered by the WPK and the Korean people to the struggle of the Namibian people for national independence and the reconstruction of the country, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

Kim Yong Nam Greets Bangladeshi President
Greetings to Bangladeshi Prime Minister
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Bangladeshi President
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of greetings to Iajuddin Ahmed, president of Bangladesh, on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president great success in his responsible work for the happiness and prosperity of the Bangladeshi people.

articles.title: NDFSK to Be Renamed AINDF
articles.content:
Greetings to Bangladeshi Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, March 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Khaleda Zia, prime minister of Bangladesh, on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of its independence.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in conformity with the mutual interests and sincerely wished the government and people of Bangladesh progress and well-being.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Bangladeshi counterpart M. Morshed Khan.
